springlite.description: An exploratory project to understand Spring's core principles (IoC, AOP). Not a production-ready framework, but a learning project focused on architecture and design patterns.

highlights.0: Implemented core IoC container with bean lifecycle management
highlights.1: Built AOP functionality using dynamic proxies
highlights.2: Achieved understanding of Spring framework internals

common.description: Spring Boot quick-start module providing response auto‑wrapping, global exception handling, a ready‑to‑use user module, and an authorization backend for Aliyun OSS. Not yet a full‑fledged starter: copy the module into a new project and adjust its pom; it includes AutoConfiguration for component scanning but lacks configuration properties.

highlights.0: Response auto‑wrapping for unified API payloads
highlights.1: Global exception handling out of the box

apklist.description: A powerful Android app to list installed applications and export them with one tap. Supports JSON/CSV/TXT, search & filters, system app recognition, Material 3 + Jetpack Compose UI, and performance optimizations for large app lists.

highlights.1: Search by app name or package; filter system/user apps
highlights.2: Show details: name, package, version, icon
highlights.3: Export to JSON, CSV, or TXT
highlights.4: Modern UI: Material 3, Jetpack Compose, light/dark theme
highlights.5: Performance: async loading, smart caching, memory-optimized scrolling
highlights.6: Tech stack: Kotlin, Compose, MVVM, Hilt, Coroutines + Flow, Coil

configformatter.description: Online configuration file format converter. Functionality and robustness are limited for now; recommended primarily for Properties <-> YAML conversions commonly used in Spring Boot.

highlights.1: Focused on Spring Boot configuration scenarios
highlights.3: Limited features; recommended mainly for Properties <-> YAML

grubtheme.description: A Python tool for managing GRUB bootloader themes, with both command-line and graphical interfaces. Includes theme playlists and random rotation, installs from file/directory/URL, and integrates with systemd to auto-switch at startup. Currently verified on Arch Linux.

highlights.1: Random switching: at boot or on-demand
highlights.2: Multi-source install: local file/directory, remote URL
highlights.4: systemd service: apply theme at startup
